issue.title: GTSMeshUtils delaunay triangulation fails on OSX

content.raw:
Here's the console output I see with both print statements:

~~~
[==========] Running 1 test from 1 test case.
[----------] Global test environment set-up.
[----------] 1 test from GTSMeshUtils
[ RUN      ] GTSMeshUtils.DelaunayTriangulation
x y intersections: 0.0833333 0.416667 3 1
x y intersections: 0.166667 0.666667 3 1
x y intersections: 0.416667 0.0833333 1 1
x y intersections: 0.916667 0.583333 1 1
x y intersections: 0.416667 0.583333 2 0
v1 0.75 0.75,  v2 0.25 0.75,  v3 0.25 0.25
x y intersections: 0.583333 0.416667 2 0
v1 0.75 0.25,  v2 0.75 0.75,  v3 0.25 0.25
x y intersections: 0.833333 0.333333 1 1
x y intersections: 0.666667 0.166667 1 1
x y intersections: 0.666667 0.833333 1 1
x y intersections: 0.416667 0.916667 1 1
[       OK ] GTSMeshUtils.DelaunayTriangulation (1 ms)
[----------] 1 test from GTSMeshUtils (1 ms total)

[----------] Global test environment tear-down
[==========] 1 test from 1 test case ran. (1 ms total)
[  PASSED  ] 1 test.
~~~

and here it is with just one print statement when it seg-faults:

~~~
[==========] Running 1 test from 1 test case.
[----------] Global test environment set-up.
[----------] 1 test from GTSMeshUtils
[ RUN      ] GTSMeshUtils.DelaunayTriangulation
v1 0.75 0.75,  v2 0.25 0.75,  v3 0.25 0.25
Segmentation fault: 11 (core dumped)
~~~

and the backtrace:

issue.title: GTSMeshUtils delaunay triangulation fails on OSX

content.html:
I've simplified the fix down to the following:

diff -r ebf4b53ee763 src/GTSMeshUtils.cc
--- a/src/GTSMeshUtils.cc       Tue Aug 29 17:32:43 2017 +0000
+++ b/src/GTSMeshUtils.cc       Mon Sep 11 22:04:57 2017 -0700
@@ -116,10 +116,14 @@

   gts_fifo_foreach(_edgeList, (GtsFunc) Intersection, data);

+  std::cerr << std::endl;
   if (intersections % 2)
     return false;
   else
+  {
+    std::cerr << std::endl;
     return true;
+  }
 }

 //////////////////////////////////////////////////

issue.title: GTSMeshUtils delaunay triangulation fails on OSX

content.raw: I think we based the code off this [delaunay.c](http://gerris.dalembert.upmc.fr/darcs/gts-stable/examples/delaunay.c) example. The difference here is new new `data` variable and the additional `Intersection` check. I'm wondering if something to do with packing `double`s and `int` into `gpointer` data and modifying the `int` in the `Intersection` function
content.html: I think we based the code off this delaunay.c example. The difference here is new new data variable and the additional Intersection check. I'm wondering if something to do with packing doubles and int into gpointer data and modifying the int in the Intersection function

issue.title: GTSMeshUtils delaunay triangulation fails on OSX

content.raw: I just tested on osx 10.11 (el capitan) and am unable to reproduce the bug. Perhaps it is a clang problem? 10.10 will be unsupported soon, so maybe we just have to wait this out.
content.html: I just tested on osx 10.11 (el capitan) and am unable to reproduce the bug. Perhaps it is a clang problem? 10.10 will be unsupported soon, so maybe we just have to wait this out.

issue.title: GTSMeshUtils delaunay triangulation fails on OSX

content.raw: clang problem on yosemite and earlier, which are no longer supported
content.html: clang problem on yosemite and earlier, which are no longer supported
